Ven Thanks, not bad for off the lawn.

Simon, those pictures and video are stellar Wars could be ended if they were to sit down and enjoy the video and pics you just shared with us Everything around me went silent as I watched,,,,it is like we were sitting there right beside you, transformed into the peace and serenity of mother nature, I'm booking a flight LOL, get another lawn chair Cheers John

I was getting another Adirondak anyway…last one got washed off my fishing rock in a storm last year! I got bait here too…just bring a rod!

No sadly, I'm one hour north of toronto.   Are ya hiring? LOL. I keep looking for work in dryden/sioux lookout/kenora area and the occasional job does pop up but, my best bet given my job experience (IT) is Winnipeg.
Jobs near me. Look at nugold
Sorry thats new gold. Emo area

Hi all,  Well as usual I was working the morning of walleye opener, but luckily I live on a great walleye lake so I snuck down the front lawn at daybreak and cast for a couple hors before work.  When I got back from work I did the same thing for a couple of hours and was again rewarded with some solid fishing.  All the fish were spawned out. Kept 4 for some food and released a bunch.  Fish were as deep as 9 feet and as shallow as 1 foot.  Slip bobber the most effective method by far, bait medium minnows.                                                                     VIDEO
